text: The Saltsjöbaden Agreement () is a Swedish labor market treaty signed between the Swedish Trade Union Confederation (sv. Landsorganisationen, LO) and the Swedish Employers Association (sv. Svenska Arbetsgivareföreningen, SAF) on December 20, 1938. It became a model for other agreements. The rules on industrial action has become regarded almost as general legal principles of conflicts between the labor market forces. == References == Category:1938 in Europe Category:20th century in Sweden Category:1930s treaties
title: Saltsjöbaden Agreement
